name: dishonoured
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
past simple and past participle of
dishonour
to cause someone or something to lose respect: He felt that he had dishonoured his country.
If you dishonour a promise or agreement, you do not do what you said you would do: We suspect he means to dishonour the agreement made three years ago.
